text: Is it a helpful use of my time to engineer a more portable/collapsible/adjustable rig?
not sure. evans kind of liked the quick prototyped 80/20 look I think
it can still be made out of 80/20
just better joints
Increasing sandbox size is a priority now over improving the rig
let me find what I was thinking for the right angle joints on the next version
and yes if you have spare time, maybe it would be best spent building a new box first
I was thinking 2 layers of 1/2" plywood this time
<http://www.amazon.com/80-20-Series-TRI-CORNER-CONNECTOR/dp/B001IA12XK>

attachments.text: 80/20 10 Series 4042 SQUARE TRI-CORNER CONNECTOR: Shelving Hardware: <http://Amazon.com|Amazon.com>: Industrial & Scientific
attachments.fallback: 80/20 10 Series 4042 SQUARE TRI-CORNER CONNECTOR: Shelving Hardware: <http://Amazon.com|Amazon.com>: Industrial & Scientific

text: these look nice
They look too simple...what's the catch?
well they require tapping the ends so a little bit of work
and will other work on corners where two or three pieces come together
I'm still not sure how it's meant to work
Will the 80/20 be drilled on the ends?
go take a look at the 1010 80/20: there is a t-slot on each of the 4 sides and a hole through the middle
would have to tap the end of the unthreaded hole with a 1/4"-20 tap if using these corner pieces
ah, ok
I think we could also use T-nuts and not have to tap anything, but then the 3 struts wouldn't meet at a perfect point
I think 3 struts meeting at one point looks nice
agreed. and tapping 3 holes is easier than welding up a joint bracket
now for weird angles, I think machining or welding a bracket would be awesome
yes! and I think we can make it so that the angle and distance-to-ground can also be adjustable
we can.. the nice thing is we know the projector throw geometry at this point and the sandbox
so we need the ability to aim it slightly but don't need to build in massive adjustability
gotcha
anyway, if you wanted to riff on that geometry I posted... friday, go for it
that's what I was thinking :)
cool
I can try to build a new wooden bottom this week in parallel
